definition: roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
register of names/attendance roll book
to attack publicly/to stage a denunciation campaign

sentences.english: Themost common-used method is to call over.
Changes into the architectural style, named theme.
sentences.chinese: 变化成建筑造型，点名主题。

sentences.english: Look, there are three things for certain in life---death, taxes and count.
sentences.chinese: 生命中有三件事是逃不掉的，死亡，税收还有点名。

sentences.english: Oh god, here we go again. Count's in 15minutes. What are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 哦天啊，又来了。15分钟后就要点名了，你要干嘛？

sentences.english: The emergency ward can now call directly for the competent specialist.
sentences.chinese: 现在急诊科有了呼救权，可直接点名呼请有关专家。

sentences.english: The results surprised some of the companies named in the report.
sentences.chinese: 报告中被点名的部分公司对结果感到惊讶。

sentences.english: Yahoo, Microsoft and Cisco are also named.
sentences.chinese: 雅虎，微软和思科也被点名。

sentences.english: This public naming and shaming is a new tactic.
sentences.chinese: 这次公开点名和羞辱是一个新的战术。

sentences.english: The new soldiers were roll-called in front of their barracks.
sentences.chinese: 新兵在他们的营房前接受点名。

sentences.english: I always cut physics class on Monday because the teacher never calls roll.
sentences.chinese: 我总是逃星期一的物理课，因为老师从不点名。

sentences.english: Could you say "yes" for me when the teacher calls the roll?
sentences.chinese: 老师点名时帮我喊一声“到”行吗？

sentences.english: All boys will attend roll-call at 9 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 全体男生务必参加九点钟点名。

sentences.english: Ask everybody to call him Mr. Li later, then he begins to call-over .
sentences.chinese: 请大家以后叫他李老师，接着他就开始点名。

sentences.english: At the roll call, the students answered up to their names.
sentences.chinese: 点名时学生们听到自己的名字都一一应到。

sentences.english: When others comment asking to be interviewed, you will ask them five questions.
sentences.chinese: 当别人在评论中要求被点名时，你将问他们一些问题。

sentences.english: At the evening roll call they discovered that he was AWOL.
sentences.chinese: 晚上点名时，发觉他开了小差。

definition: to praise/to commend
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to make a speech/statement/utterance/CL:個|个[ge4]
to admonish subordinates
to report for duty/to check in/to register
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to take the lead/to be the first/to set an example
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to request leave of absence
to sb's face/in sb's presence
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
to question/to ask/to raise a question
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
public/to publish/to make public
